title: Strictly It Takes Two viewers left in hysterics following filthy innuendo blunder
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Click to play Tap to play

Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Strictly It Takes Two viewers were left in hysterics after guest Rustie Lee unintentionally made a filthy innuendo on Friday's episode.

The TV personality, 66, made a guest appearance on the spin-off show, hosted by Rylan Clark- Neal, alongside Scarlett Moffatt and Ruth Langsford to discuss the 2019 contestants.

Rustie caused TV watchers to "roar" and "screech" with laughter after she made a saucy remark.

The moment came after the guests and Rylan watched a clip of Anton DuBeke and Emma Barton rehearsing ahead of Saturday’s Halloween themed show.

Scarlett and Ruth gushed over Anton, which led to Rylan quizzing Rustie if she agreed.

She said: “I do and he is a baker, which is right up my street as I am a master baker as wells you all know!”

Shocked, Ruth asked:"Sorry?”

(Image: BBC)

Before Rylan, who is celebrating his birthday today, over accentuated to the camera: “Master baker, she said.”

Which was met by a gaggle of laughter by the studio audience.

He then joked: “This is BBC Two Rustie! Have a bit of decorum! Please, this is a family show!"

Rustie was unable to hold back her giggles as she doubled over and covered her face.

Rylan then added: “Let’s swiftly move on, somebody please get the woman a fan!”

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

Fans at home found the blunder equally as hilarious and took to Twitter to share their glee.

An abused watcher penned: "Hearing Rusty Lee say she's a master baker made my evening #StrictlyItTakesTwo."

"@Rylanhappy birthday you rascal! Screeching with laughter at ‘Master Baker”…typed another.

A entertained fan added: "Please can we have the wonderful @Rustie_Lee on every week please? MASTER BAKER!! #ItTakesTwo #Strictly."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

"Roaring at #ITT all sanity has been lost! #MasterBaker @Rylan," offered another.

Proving she was a big hit some micro-blogged: "@Rustie_Lee is an absolute treasure #ITT #Strictly" and "We need more Rusty Lee on our TV! #ITT @StrictlyITT."

*It Takes Two airs weekdays on BBC2 at 6.30pm
description: TV fans were in stitches after guest Rustie Lee unintentionally made a cheeky innuendo
